issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.

fields.summary: Deleting a volume that does not exist using euca-delete-volume does not return an error

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: *Assessment* InvalidVolume.NotFound is not returned when an invalid volume ID is used with DescribeVolumes or CreateSnapshot EC2 actions. {code} $ euca-describe-volumes vol-84E13F04 --region account2-user11@ $ $ euca-create-snapshot vol-84E13F04 --region account2-user11@ euca-create-snapshot: error (CreateSnapshotType): example: [Volume size=null scName=null partition=null parentSnapshot=null remoteDevice=null localDevice=null fullName=null tags=null ownerUserId=null ownerUserName=null ownerAccountNumber=137614824505 ownerAccountName=null uniqueName=null ownerFullNameCached=null state=null lastState=null stateChangeStack=null displayName=vol-84E13F04 id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null] {code} *Signs* * Debug message for both CreateSnapshot and DescribeVolumes against Eucalyptus: {code} $ euca-describe-volumes vol-84E13F04 --region account2-user11@ --debug 2014-04-05 23:34:51,317 DEBUG fields.summary: AWS Error Code InvalidVolume.NotFound Not Supported

comments.body:
The reported create snapshot issue was already addressed in 4.0 by EUCA-9070.

Moving this issue to 4.2 as we need to look if there is impact on (internal) clients of EC2 (db vm?), when fixed QA tests need updating to allow for the possible error response when describing volumes.

Some initial work on this issue is here:
https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/7874fd23951bae99680cebe6f3ae59f0695f0a23

In review while QA tests are updated, current failures are:

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/dev-test-regression-test/2277/
